br.span: The best view comes after the hardest climb.

td.style: padding: 18px;color: #F2F2F2;font-family: Helvetica;font-size: 14px;font-weight: normal;text-align: center;mso-line-height-rule: exactly;-ms-text-size-adjust: 100%;-webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%;word-break: break-word;line-height: 150%;

span.style: font-family: arial, "helvetica neue", helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;
span.strong:
- Our schools are closed through April 10, 2020.
- The school year will NOT be extended if the closure is lifted.
- The statewide assessment (i.e., AZM2 & AIMS Science) is cancelled.
- Our school letter grades will remain the same as last school year. Elementary = C & MS/HS = D.
- Third grade students are exempt from the requirement that they obtain a passing score on the reading portion of the statewide assessment to be promoted.
- The State Board of Education will adopt rules for high school graduation. Stay tuned for those details.
- Our new buildings construction is still on schedule for July 2020 completion.
We will continue to provide a breakfast and lunch bag on Tuesdays-Fridays. Also, our new extra-credit enrichment packets are available in the Library lobby daily from 9:00 a.m. - 2:00 p.m. Please keep your children educationally stimulated during this break.
We look forward to seeing everyone soon.

span.style: font-family: arial, "helvetica neue", helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;
span.strong:
24-Hour Crisis Line (Maricopa County) 1.977.756.4090 - TTY/TDY: 711. Linea Directa de Crisis disponible las 24 hours.
Suicide Prevention Line (Text format). Text HOME to 741741.
Southwest Behavioral Services (SBS)
SBS can provide individual and/or family counseling, psychological testing/evaluation, and health promotion to name a few of their services. If your child is struggling with cutting, suicidal thoughts, anxiety, depression, or other youth concerns, SBS CAN HELP. SBS accepts AHCCCS, most insurances, sliding scale, or private pay as options for payment. We encourage families to utilize this resource. SBS is located in Goodyear. To start, contact Kathy Villa at 602.525.3329.
Association for Supportive Child Care (ASCC)
ASCC can provide in home training and support on topics including child development, language and literacy, daily schedule planning, nutrition, brain development, and guidance/discipline. This is a free program. Contact them today at 480.829.0500 ext. 1212.
Building Bright Futures
Building Bright Futures can support parents by helping them gain knowledge of their child's development and gain positive parenting techniques. Services are free and voluntary with no income requirements. Their phone number is 602.234.3941.
